intro: Paepalanthus pilifer, commonly known as the woolly pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its striking foliage and delicate blooms.
